title: Modern Europe, 1789-1914
description: Europe's 'long nineteenth century' reveals continuity and dramatic changes in politics, social structures and identities, forms of cultural expression, and scientific and technological knowledge. Topics include the French and Industrial revolutions; liberalism; nationalism; socialism; modernism; imperialism; and World War I. 4 lectures. Crosslisted as HIST/HNRSÂ 334. Fulfills GE D5 except for History majors.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area A and two courses from Area D1, D2 or D3
